info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 2:54PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Lewis and Clark County through 345 PM MDT... At 254 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lincoln, or 28 miles northeast of Drummond, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lincoln. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
